description: ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY SIDE AND REAR EXTENSIONS, A SIRST FLOOR SIDE EXTENSION AND A ROOF EXTENSION
decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The scale, form, design and positioning of the proposal would have an undue detrimental impact upon the character or appearance of the host building, character of the surrounding area and streetscenes of Latimer Road and Wycliffe Road. Therefore, the proposal fails to comply with policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the Adopted Sites and Policies Plan 2014, Policy CS14 of the Core Strategy 2011 and 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016. 
Reason : 2 - The scale, form and depth of the proposed rear roof extension would have an undue detrimental impact upon the amenities of number 42 Latimer Road by reason of an increase sense of enclosure, loss of light and overshadowing. Therefore, the proposal fails to comply with policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the Adopted Sites and Policies Plan 2014, CS14 of the LBM Core Strategy 2011 and 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.
Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The applicant/agent was informed of any issues arising during consideration of the application. 
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
